programme.title: Worlds Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Celebrities undertake journeys on some of the most perilous routes in the world. In Alaska, Sue Perkins and Charley Boorman drive along the notorious Dalton Highway, a dirt track originally constructed in the 1970s as a supply road for the Trans-Alaska oil pipeline. The pair struggle to cope with the Arctic conditions and constant threat of avalanches, but receive help from experienced truckers who teach them some unwritten rules for surviving the roads many hazards

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Millions of dollars worth of marijuana is found hidden in a shipment of mattresses, and officers detain a mother and daughter who have been smoking meth

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A man wanted for murder is apprehended at the border, and officers discover over 80 kilograms of cocaine hidden inside a tractor-trailer

programme.title: Outback Pilots
programme.desc: Documentary outlining the work of pilots who risk their lives every day flying through Australias inhospitable Outback terrain. Crop-dusting ace Dennis faces extreme low-level flying in a race to complete the biggest job of the year, while Trevor and his rookie aviators prepare to save tourists in a fierce storm

programme.title: Outback Pilots
programme.desc: Documentary outlining the work of pilots who risk their lives every day flying through Australias inhospitable Outback terrain

programme.title: Special Ops: To Catch a Criminal
programme.desc: City of London Police begin a dangerous high-speed chase when the UKs most notorious phone snatcher races into the Square Mile on an illegal electric bike

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers are on alert for a cartel ambush as they transfer a Sicario to the Mexican military. A random inspection of a pick-up truck reveals 32kg of narcotics

programme.title: Aussie Road Train Truckers
programme.desc: Its the end of the dry season as Des delivers a record-breaking load to a secret multi-billion-dollar mine and Glen tackles the territorys most dangerous road

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris and Freddie Flintoff tackle the Baja 1000 off-road race. On the test track, a showdown is held between a Renault hot hatch, a Porsche sports car and an old Lamborghini. Guests Laurence and Emilia Fox drop in to the studio

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness, Freddie Flintoff and Chris Harris take sports cars from Ferrari, Aston Martin and Porsche on a Yorkshire road trip. Back on the track, Chris tests out Volkswagens ID-R electric racer. YouTube star KSI is the studio guest

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the nations love of bread, tracing its development over the course of centuries. In addition to trying their hands at bagel-making, they create their own version of summer pudding, and prepare a soup-and-roll combination

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Cornwall has more than its fair share of folktales. Perhaps the most famous is found near Lands End, where Rick recounts the tale of the Mermaid of Zennor. A short distance away, he joins a small army of seaweed harvesters who are feeding an increasing appetite for a natural food more common in Japan

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick roams the dramatic north Cornish coast to tell the story of one of Britains best-loved writers, Thomas Hardy, and his little-known love affair with a Cornishwoman. Another famous writer, Dylan Thomas, once dubbed Ricks next stop, Mousehole, as the loveliest village in Britain. Its here that Rick discovers the origins of the iconic Cornish dish stargazy pie

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Guest panellists Jo Brand, Sam Quek, Bobby Seagull and Joe Thomas join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Jessie Cave, Ayesha Hazarika, Simon Hickson and AJ Pritchard go toe to toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Rickie Haywood-Williams, Sally Phillips, Vikki Stone and Dan Walker test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Kevin Bridges hosts an extended episode of the satirical quiz, with regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton joined by journalist Helen Lewis and comedian Chloe Petts

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Josh Widdicombe, Cariad Lloyd and Paul Sinha join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig considers various phenomena. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts as team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by actor Henry Winkler, comedians Henning Wehn and Romesh Ranganathan, and Olympic swimmer Rebecca Adlington. As usual, the panellists discuss and dissect the events that have set the British publics chins wagging over the past week

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regulars Chris Addison, Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Josh Widdicombe, Ed Byrne and Hal Cruttenden on the topical comedy quiz, with the panellists giving their take on the weeks major news stories

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Steph McGovern, Richard Osman, Jennifer Saunders and Joe Sugg join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds including Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Guest panellists Jo Brand, Sam Quek, Bobby Seagull and Joe Thomas join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Survivor South Africa
programme.desc: Set on beautiful, scattered islands connected by the Pacific ocean in the Palawan province of the Philippines, this season of Survivor sees eighteen diverse castaways from South Africas rainbow nation fighting it out to become the Sole Survivor, including one wild-card entry - a fan who clinched a spot on the show beating other wannabe Survivor contenders at a gruelling public outdoor event

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade returns with the offbeat tourism show and is joined in the first edition by comedy actress and writer Dawn French, with the pair spending two days in the Greek capital. Their mini-break features doughnuts, the Acropolis and the thermal waters of Lake Vouliagmeni, which is rumoured to be the goddess Athenas favourite bathing spot. Richard and Dawn sample a 14-course tasting menu at a temple to molecular gastronomy, before they go on an Olympic tour featuring discus and javelin training

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Worlds Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Rhod Gilbert and Greg Davies negotiate a variety of unusual hazards as they travel through Nepal, a country with one of the worlds highest rates of road traffic accidents. Frequent floods and landslides mean car journeys are often fraught with danger, and matters are not helped by the varied states of Nepalese roads, which range from urban highways to crumbling mountain passes

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers investigate a collector travelling with parts of a space rocket, and 380 kilograms of crystal meth is discovered in a shipment of limes

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: 24 kilograms of cocaine are found concealed in the air tank of a truck, and a cache of weapons bound for Mexico is intercepted

programme.title: Outback Pilots
programme.desc: Repa calls in reinforcements in a dog fight with the weather to complete the mission. Meanwhile, police pilot Rob faces a deadly traffic jam on the beat at 12,000ft. Documentary outlining the work of pilots who risk their lives every day flying through Australias inhospitable Outback terrain

programme.title: Outback Pilots
programme.desc: Heli-duster Brett takes protecting crops to a new level, while using every trick in the trade, Scott veers between Outback crises. Trevor and Josh dance with danger in strong winds

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Documentary with unrestricted access to Americas Customs and Border Protection working on the bridges that separate Texas and Mexico, following the work of the many officers who police the bridges and keep America safe. In the first episode, a shipment of cardboard packaging hides a deadly secret, and heroin disguised as a laptop baffles the worlds most advanced narcotic detection device

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers are suspicious when an elderly couple arrive from Mexico with five suitcases but no clothes, and a truck carrying garden furniture has something extra in the load

programme.title: Train Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: The Ghans maintenance team must race to ensure the train departs the next day, and a routine job on a Queensland Rail commuter train hits a snag

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness, Freddie Flintoff and Chris Harris put emergency vehicles to the test to see if the fire brigade, the police or the ambulance service has the fastest vehicles. Chris pays tribute to rally driver Colin McRae, Paddy puts the new BMW M8 through its paces, and comedian Tom Allen joins the team in the studio

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness host the motoring magazine, heading to Paddys home town of Bolton to test three company cars by spending 24 hours in them - with no getting out. Chris also heads to Italy to put the Ferrari SF90 supercar through its paces

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the history of the Vegetarian Society and discover how the movement changed public attitudes and became part of the mainstream. They also consider how British gardening has influenced the nations cuisine, and provide a few recipes along the way

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef heads out from Newquay to catch Cornish king crab, then goes to Bodmin Moor to meet explorer Robin Hanbury-Tenison to find out a rewilding project on his farm for which his son Merlin has recently introduced a pair of wild beavers

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick boards the ferry in Penzance to take him to the Isles of Scilly, where he learns about the islands rich history, including one of the Royal Navys worst shipping disasters in which 1500 men lost their lives. Later, he meets a beekeeper who is attempting to breed a native Scillonian honeybee who can deal with the harsh Atlantic climate, which inspires Rick to cook a honey pudding with Cornish ice-cream and a butterscotch sauce

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? at Christmas
programme.desc: Festive edition of the award-winning comedy panel show, with actor Jim Broadbent, broadcaster Angela Rippon and comedians Rose Matafeo and Ardal OHanlon joining host Rob Brydon and team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack. As ever, the players reveal amazing stories about themselves - but are they telling the truth or making it all up? Can their opponents sort the wheat from the chaff and take away whatever seasonal spoils are to be had?

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Jessie Cave, Ayesha Hazarika, Simon Hickson and AJ Pritchard go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: On day two, former victors Rickie Haywood-Williams, Sally Phillips, Vikki Stone and Dan Walker hope they have what it takes to win, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Professor Hannah Fry hosts an extended episode of the satirical quiz, as broadcaster Carol Vorderman and comedian Phil Wang join team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to delve into the news. Collectively, they poke fun at the weeks headlines

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sindhu Vee, Rhod Gilbert and Ed Byrne join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig looks at pathology, the causal study of disease based on the analysis of bodily fluids. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by comedians Tom Rosenthal, Roisin Conaty and Rob Delaney, along with Strictly Come Dancing judge Craig Revel Horwood to discuss and dissect events that set the British publics chins wagging in October 2014. Jimmy Carr hosts the irreverent panel show

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regulars Chris Addison, Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Rob Beckett, Ed Byrne and Chris Ramsey on the topical comedy quiz, with the panellists giving their take on the weeks major news stories

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Tom Allen, Geoff Norcott, Vicki Pepperdine and Esme Young join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds including Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? at Christmas
programme.desc: Festive edition of the award-winning comedy panel show, with actor Jim Broadbent, broadcaster Angela Rippon and comedians Rose Matafeo and Ardal OHanlon joining host Rob Brydon and team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack. As ever, the players reveal amazing stories about themselves - but are they telling the truth or making it all up? Can their opponents sort the wheat from the chaff and take away whatever seasonal spoils are to be had?

programme.title: Survivor South Africa
programme.desc: Set on beautiful, scattered islands connected by the Pacific Ocean in the Palawan province of the Philippines, this season of Survivor sees eighteen diverse castaways from South Africas rainbow nation fighting it out to become the Sole Survivor. In this episode, Tom seeks to solidify his position with the voting block after nearly being eliminated at the Tribal Council.

programme.title: Doctors

programme.title: Doctors

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Lisa visits a remote farmhouse to assist a home birth, but complications put the mothers life in danger and leave the midwife with a difficult decision _ whether to wait for an ambulance or break strict rules by driving the patient to hospital in her own car. Meanwhile, Mubbs learns that a former lover has contracted a sexually transmitted disease _ which means he may have passed it on to Lisa

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Zoe nervously prepares to tell Sharice she plans to foster her. programme.title: The Bill

programme.title: Classic EastEnders

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Dotty and Nicks plan comes to fruition despite Bradleys interference. Garry is hiding a secret. Bianca gets what-for from Pat. Christian takes control of the Beale empire

programme.title: Miss Fishers Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: An actor dies during a production of Gilbert and Sullivan operetta Ruddigore, and the unusual circumstances pose sleuth Phryne Fisher with another difficult case. She also visits Chinatown both to investigate its illicit trade in opium and meet the handsome Lin Chung. Essie Davis stars in the crime drama set in 1920s Melbourne

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: The legacy of Paul and Lexies secret kiss strains relations between them, but despite initial reservations, she reconsiders her decision to leave Glenbogle. Meanwhile, Duncan and Molly reveal details of a hidden past that threaten to have dramatic implications for the rest of the family

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim sets out to prove the French police were wrong to accuse a man of murdering his wife. John Nettles plays the Jersey detective

programme.title: Terry and June
programme.desc: The warring couple have problems when wardrobes are fitted in their bedroom. Terry Scott and June Whitfield star

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg agrees to drive Ludovics newly acquired van home for him, but finds the vehicle rather worse for wear. Rural comedy, starring Peter Sallis and Bryan Pringle

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo, Clegg and Foggy put their unique talents to good use in the church concert, but only one of them has his heart set on ensuring the venture is a success. Comedy, starring Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Brian Wilde

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The maverick judge finds his principles tested by the offer of a place on the Appellate Bench in return for hushing up a diplomatic incident. Drama, starring Martin Shaw

Guest starring Shane Richie, Naomi Bentley and Claire Rushbrook

programme.title: The Bill

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Nick leaves the Square with a bang, but who will be caught in the firing line? Bianca resolves to be a proper mother, while Christian realises that being Ian Beale is not easy

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The Square struggles to cope with the aftermath of Nicks exit. Elsewhere, Dawn is made an offer, Christian stares oblivion in the face, and Whitney encounters a mystery man

programme.title: Miss Fishers Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Famous French painter Pierre Sarcelle dies at Montparnasse train station, the victim of an apparent accident. Essie Davis stars

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Donald and Ewans fishing trip inadvertently brings a long-buried secret to light with the discovery of a lost German fighter plane in the loch. Isobel knows her godfather, local butcher Irvine Taylor, was the pilot and resolves to keep everyone else in the dark - but an MoD investigation threatens to scupper her plans. Elsewhere, Molly is devastated to learn she has a heart condition and a lonely Jess unwittingly agrees to take part in a karaoke competition with Ewan

programme.title: Bergerac

Comedy, starring Joe McGann, Diana Weston and Kellie Bright

programme.title: Terry and June

programme.desc: More expertly crafted comedy sketches from Harry Enfield and colleagues-in-mirth Paul Whitehouse and Kathy Burke, featuring the Camp Jockeys, the Scousers and Kevin the teenager

programme.title: Harry Enfield and Chums
programme.desc: Kevin the Teenager falls ill and Tim Nice-but-Dim finds a kindred spirit when he meets Dick Nice-but-Thick. Comedy, with Kathy Burke and Paul Whitehouse

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: Denise is a bag of nerves as her wedding day finally arrives, while Jim is practising his speech and Antony is being teased about his new haircut. Alone in the house after the others have left for the church, Jim is uncharacteristically tender in soothing Denises nerves

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee is looking forward to a lazy weekend when his dad turns up on the doorstep, looking for somewhere to stay having just come out of hospital - and in need of someone to care for him. Bobby Ball guest stars, with Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: One Born Every Minute

Trevor and Natalie, who have had a difficult relationship, prepare for the birth of their third child, while Hasan cannot stand to hear his partner Dianes screams during labour, and keeps leaving the room

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Golden retriever poodle-cross Sukis front legs have developed abnormally and now require urgent attention as the bones of her forearms are growing at different rates, so Noel decides that major surgery is required. Beloved elderly Labrador Raffa is nearly 11 and has become lame with constant pain in his front legs, and Noel discovers cartilage erosion in both elbows. Meanwhile, five-year-old dachshund Zizi is rushed in after suddenly losing the use of her back legs overnight, and an urgent MRI scan confirms that Zizi has suffered an exploded disc

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A couple bring their 13-month-old cocker spaniel puppy in for scheduled surgery for hip dysplasia which will require two separate full hip replacements. Elsewhere, two-year-old cat Jazz is rushed in by mum Sarah suffering from a smashed femur and shattered thorax after being hit by a car, and eight-year-old dachshund Olive is treated after suddenly losing the use of her back legs

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The documentary returns to capture life in the maternity unit at Liverpool Womens Hospital. Students Brooke and Tim, both aged 23, who became inseparable when they met in their first term at university, become parents for the first time and have difficulty deciding on a name for their baby, while things dont go according to plan in theatre for 40-year-old Hayley. She is afraid of being separated from her 23-year-old partner Nick, after he became critically ill during the pregnancy as a result of contracting pneumonia and septicaemia. Meanwhile, Tara, aged 36, has chosen her 16-year-old daughter Courtney as her birthing partner

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Three more sets of parents-to-be arrive at Liverpool Womens Hospital to welcome new additions to their families, including 29-year-old Kate and her 32-year-old husband Pete, whose short-term memory was damaged following a hard-fought battle against meningitis and encephalitis 10 years earlier. The pair hope Petes brain injury will not stop him from being able to recall this memorable moment in the future. Also featured is third-time mother Lisa, whose previous two labours only lasted six and four hours respectively, and former drama school student Hayley, who already has children with her other-half Stephen, and has resolved to appreciate every moment with her family after losing her own mother at an early age

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Four more people test their DNA to help answer life-changing questions, including Clare, who wonders whether her Dad was a British soldier during the Troubles. Leigh only discovered that he might have a secret sister after his mum passed away, while it was only when Jenna and Ryan were pregnant that they realised they both carry a genetic mutation that could be deadly if passed on to their kids

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Saffy is persuaded to allow Patsy and Eddie to babysit for the day, allowing her to have some romantic time with John - unaware the pair have an ulterior motive involving a fashion shoot and an outrageous designer. Fern Britton and Jean-Paul Gaultier guest star

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Well-respected midwife Linda Abbott retires after 38 years service and reminisces about her career, including delivering several generations of some families. Before leaving she helps with the delivery of nervous 22-year-old Michelles baby, after the soon-to-be single mum spent a difficult night alone on the ward. Meanwhile, Lauren and Kirk prepare for the arrival of their first child. The couple had tried to have a baby for five years, and just as they were about to start medical tests they conceived naturally

Pete returns to Dogs Trust, facing a suitcase of abandoned pups on day one and falling hard for Theo, a gentle Italian Mastiff with a serious heart condition.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: In a One Born Every Minute special, cameras follow four couples through their multiple pregnancies and births. Ana and Paul are thrilled at the prospect of becoming first-time parents to triplets, but receive worrying news at a routine scan, while Beth has to have emergency laser surgery in her womb after her babies are diagnosed with twin-to-twin transfusion syndrome. Carolyne and Gordon, already parents to four children, are shocked to discover they can expect three more, while Sophie and Carlos try to cope with the premature arrival of their two daughters

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next?
programme.desc: Three couples who have featured on the programme share their experiences of parenthood 12 months after they originally took part. A woman explains why it will not be easy for her partner to cope with looking after their child when she returns to work, and another couple voice their concerns about the effect that starting a family has had on their health. Meanwhile, Lucy seeks her husbands approval as she decides to resume her career as an opera singer

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: Teams respond to calls including an 88-year-olds severe head wound, a hair-raising motorbike accident, a serious burn incident and a challenging 170kg patient extraction

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: The team deals with a diabetic coma. Meanwhile, a passenger needs to be rescued from a burning car, an anaphylactic child requires immediate attention and an explosion rocks Chinatown

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Georgina was conceived during a holiday romance 34 years ago when her mother fell for a Portuguese waiter, and now, she wants to know if her father is still alive. Matthew grew up in foster care never knowing where his father came from, and he longs to discover the truth about his ancestry and if he is actually Caribbean

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr transform the courtyard into a Mediterranean oasis. To brush up on their botany, the pair visit the magnificent gardens of one of Sicilys biggest wine producers, where they help out with the grape harvest. Keen to create an authentic Sicilian design, Alan explores Sciaccas famous ceramic scene and gets arty painting Moor Heads. He also enlists the help of two baroque-style painters to bring a touch of the islands rich history with a surprise courtyard centrepiece. Amanda repairs the old courtyard walls, which turns out to be a far bigger job than anticipated

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels between Liverpool and Wales. Along the way he discovers a childhood favourite - a miniature tank engine with three carriages in dark red - made by Frank Hornby, and learns the story of a Welsh countess who lived in Gwrych Castle. In Snowdonia, he also rides the waves with a Welsh surfing champion

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In picturesque Snowdonia, Michael Portillo braves the fastest zip line in the world - stretching 1,500 feet across a vast slate quarry as he begins the last leg of his journey to Caernarfon. En route, he also visits the home of British mountaineering, Pen y Gwryd, to hear how an Edwardian journalist and poet created a climbing community, which grew to include men who would conquer Everest in the 1950s

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Hassocks and makes his way to the beautiful Sussex village of Ditchling, where a Roman Catholic community of artists once made their home. Next, he visits the seaside town of Bexhill-on-Sea, before the Kent and East Sussex heritage railway conveys Michael from Bodiam Castle through the scenic Rother Valley to Tenterden, and finally arrives in the village of Benenden

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo follows his 1930s Bradshaws guide to the unspoilt East Sussex port of Rye, where he learns about the loss of a generation of lifeboatmen in 1928. On the beaches at Rye, Michael explores one of 28,000 pillboxes constructed around the British coastline during the Second World War, before boarding the Romney, Hythe and Dymchurch railway to Dungeness

programme.desc: Dereks on his way to Blackpool to pick up what will be the highest priced item at the next auction. But, the 1970 Aston Martin DBS needs a tow to the local garage

programme.desc: How the morale of the Third Reich, boosted by Germanys initial military successes, was shattered by the devastating defeat at Stalingrad, relentless Allied bombing raids and an attempt on Hitlers life. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the experts pay a second visit to Hopetoun House in South Queensferry, Edinburgh, valuing items including Victorian dresses worn by royalty, a silver jewel box that dates back to the 16th century and a famous photograph of the Forth Bridge that was used as part of a Nazi propaganda campaign during the Second World War

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

programme.title: The Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Brian Dowling and his fashion-forward design team continue their mission to prove to the nation that it is possible achieve a dream home renovation at little cost. Changing Rooms meets the Repair Shop with a new sustainable twist, the challenge here is to transform our bland old rooms, furniture and fittings into unique and stunning show stoppers, using only upcycling and sustainable methods. This is the home makeover format for the world we live in today, as two households per week, each with a team consisting of an interior designer and an up-cycling wiz, have just four days and 1,000 euro to renovate and rejuvenate a tired spaces in their home, filling them with home-made, re-used and revamped furnishings. Two families are selected from the same region each week and each has a tired room in need of renovation and re-imagining containing a potential treasure trove of up-cycling gems

But will Jake be impressed by the Bikers suggestions?

programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King visit a vegetarian Indian restaurant on the outskirts of Bradford. Its run by a husband-and-wife team aiming for a Michelin star

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi climbs aboard floating hotel the African Queen, situated on the Thames, to help owners Bonny and Andy Cowley improve their 30 per cent occupancy. Although she is impressed with the accommodation and quality of food on the 85-year-old Dutch barge, Alex fears Andys approach to hosting is too zealous. She suggests he add extra touches to the bedrooms and spruce up the scruffy exterior, before inviting local businesspeople to a relaunch party

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Former Liberty X star Michelle Heaton hosts a dinner party for four guests who must use a series of clues on offer to ascertain her identity, win a cash prize and avoid having to wash up. Hosted by Brian McFadden

programme.title: Heathrow: Britains Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Storm Eunice wreaks havoc at Heathrow airport, as staff deal with a deluge of delays and unhappy passengers, and also try to deter debris from hitting the runway. Elsewhere, passenger experience manager Harry has to deal with a breach of security that affects hundreds of passengers jetting off on holiday

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A Russian trawlerman found hiding in a local womans shed is accused of being a spy by a Home Office official (The Office star Patrick Baladi) - but Walker and Carol discover the government worker has secrets of his own to hide. Peggy turns detective after an old note found among a dead friends belongings raises questions about her husbands disappearance. With Jonathan Kerrigan and Lisa Kay

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: A Breath of French Air - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. The family warms to the French way of life, but Charley is unhappy with Mariettes flirting - and after a little Dutch courage, decides to take matters into his own hands. Drama, starring Philip Franks and Catherine Zeta-Jones

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Anyas condition worsens as Bear vows to look after her, while Vinny sees through Lewiss false positivity and Kev gets a surprise

programme.desc: Adam is quick to question Dr Weatherills competence when a beach outing ends tragically for a family. Dr Ormerod leaps in to defend her - but ends up revealing his colleagues condition in his haste. Meanwhile, Dr Goodwin struggles to help a pair of teenage parents gain access to their baby. Amy Robbins and Robert Daws star

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.desc: Lady Virginia Revel receives a marriage proposal from an ambitious politician, but is reluctant to accept it, especially as she is also being courted by a dashing young suitor. Accompanied by Miss Marple, she travels to a weekend party at her family home Chimneys, hoping to reach a decision. Negotiations for the sale of the country house are taking place during the gathering, but when new owner Count Ludwig of Austria is found murdered, St Mary Meads elderly spinster must identify the culprit. Whodunit, starring Julia McKenzie, with a supporting cast including Gavin and Stacey stars Ruth Jones and Mathew Horne, plus Dervla Kirwan, Charlotte Salt, Michelle Collins, Jonas Armstrong and Edward Fox

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Peggy begins a frantic search for Davids dog Deefer after a pair of youths steal her car from outside the Aidensfield Arms with the hound in the boot. Carol and Rob have cause for concern as Rosie is troubled by the attentions of an admirer who simply will not take no for an answer - and also has a history of violence against a former girlfriend. Jonathan Kerrigan, Gwen Taylor and Vanessa Hehir star

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: As a doctor arrives to make a study of lung diseases at Wheal Leisure, Ross sets about forming an alliance with his fellow mine-owners to build their own smelting company and break Warleggans stranglehold on copper prices. However, Francis is deeply in debt to George - and what money he does have is being spent on lavish gifts for ambitious prostitute Margaret. Demelza resolves to lift Veritys spirits by reconciling her with her lost love Captain Blamey, and theres a new woman in Marks life - but she demands he finds her a home before they are married

programme.desc: A damage regulator is sent to investigate an accident on an oil rig two days before Christmas, but just as the crew realise it was a murder, the rig is cut off from the mainland by a hurricane, while the murderer is still among everyone on board. Drama, starring David Dencik

programme.title: Mum
programme.desc: As the summer draws to a close, Cathy and Michael see each other for the first time in months. Meanwhile, Maureen is in hospital and Reg waits anxiously for the news. Subtle family comedy, starring Lesley Manville, Peter Mullan and Lisa McGrillis

programme.title: Mum
programme.desc: Its November and Cathy is having a bonfire. As Michael attempts to move on after the death of his mother, Cathy feels she needs to tell him something. Comedy, starring Lesley Manville and Peter Mullan

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An elderly man reports an unusual break-in, during which the uninvited visitor left a mysterious statue on the kitchen table. It soon emerges that it is just the first in a series of unexplained events, as a police phone box arrives and then disappears from his garden, cement is delivered to his house for no apparent reason and a fire is started in his garage. Noakes advises Steve to keep well away as it is not technically a police matter, but the officer decides to investigate further. Rural drama, starring Trevor Ray, Georgie Glen and James Carlton

programme.title: Good Witch
programme.desc: When two guests arrive at Grey House and are immediately at odds, Cassie uses her magic to ensure that until the two guests realise they belong together, every day in Middleton will be just like to one before it. Sam tries to plan the perfect date for Cassie, but various nuisances keep getting in the way. Abigail continues getting the same delivery over and over, until she recognizes the value she provides the community

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Go Local
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King visit the Stackpole Inn in Pembrokeshire, a multi award-winning gastro pub. Owners Gary and Becky first took it on 15 years ago, and were joined in 2019 by head chef Matt Waldron. Its the Bikers mission to introduce Matt and team Stackpole to the fantastic local food producers that arent yet on their radar

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi sets out to improve the fortunes of the Glangrwyney Court guest house in the Black Mountains, Powys. Despite its five-star rating and reasonable occupancy rate, owners Christina and Warrick Jackson reveal they are rapidly losing money. Alex is taken aback by the amount of clutter in the rooms and the low prices being charged, and informs the couple that if they make changes, their salvation could lie in targeting the lucrative corporate market

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Gillian McKeith hosts a dinner party for four guests, who will win a cash prize if they can guess her identity from cryptic culinary clues. Raw lasagne is among the healthy options the nutritionist is planning to serve and whoever loses the challenge will have to do the washing-up. Presented by Brian McFadden

programme.title: Heathrow: Britains Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Police mount a special operation across the airport, and passenger experience manager Taz rushes to the aid of a passenger on her way to Warsaw who takes a tumble on an escalator. Elsewhere, a five-star airline tries to make a comeback with its business class

Robert Daws, Denis Lill, Amelia Curtis and Paul Fox star

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.desc: Millionaires wife Mary Pritchard, a notoriously demanding invalid, apparently dies of shock in her locked room when the geranium in her wallpaper turns blue, fulfilling the dire warning of a mysterious fortune teller. The manner of her death creates a sensation in the tense village community of Little Ambrose, but although the womans husband confesses to the crime, Miss Marple uncovers new evidence that could affect the court hearings outcome and races to halt proceedings before the wrong person is convicted. Starring Julia McKenzie, with Toby Stephens, Sharon Small, Patrick Baladi, Caroline Catz, Claire Rushbrook and Donald Sinden

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Walker and Miller struggle to decide whether an ex-Army major is guilty of murder after shooting a youth who broke into his home, while Carol tries to get through to a pregnant teenager. Rosie learns the garage is in financial trouble - unaware Peggy and a salesman with big ideas (impressionist Jon Culshaw) have already dreamed up a plan that could save it. Jonathan Kerrigan and Gwen Taylor star

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The body of a man killed by a single gunshot wound is discovered on the moors and a burnt-out truck containing the remains of a deer is found a mile away. Joe is convinced the case is a poaching war gone wrong, but delving into the victims story, Vera unearths a sad childhood in the country and a troubled life in the city, scraping by as a novelist. Following the death of his grandfather, he returned to Northumberland after a 15-year absence to sell his inheritance - but pulled out of the deal at the last minute. Could his death be linked to a dispute over land? Brenda Blethyn and David Leon star

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Aaron finds what he is looking for, while Belle formulates a new plan and Bear is torn

programme.title: Rig 45
programme.desc: The remaining crew is split into two groups as everyone suspects each other of being the murderer. Tensions rise and as the crew buckles down, waiting for help to arrive, they realise they must start talking in order to solve the mystery. Drama, starring Catherine Walker

programme.title: Trigger Point
programme.desc: The terror campaign continues when a journalist is sent a suspicious package, suggesting a new bomb set to explode that evening. The gang appears to be taunting the authorities, but a source then emerges from the shadows with what appears to be solid intelligence on the terror cell. With little else to go on, can mysterious informant Alex really be trusted?

programme.title: Mum
programme.desc: Cathy and her family arrive in the countryside to celebrate Dereks birthday. Michael is there too, which Jason finds troubling. Family comedy, starring Lesley Manville, Peter Mullan, Sam Swainsbury and Ross Boatman

programme.title: Pressure Pad
programme.desc: General knowledge quiz, hosted by John Barrowman, in which two teams of five players are pitted against each other inside an illuminated arena, known as the Pressure Pad. The team with the most players remaining for the final round will put itself in the strongest position to win the jackpot, which starts at £3,000. The prize money rolls over to the next weeks competition if neither team is victorious

programme.desc: Andrew OKeefe presents the Down Under version of the quiz show in which four people must work together to beat the Chaser and win a cash prize.

Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot
